Related Publication.Citation: Schuh, M., Schendel, S., Klassen, K., Morrison, L., Rankin, K. N., Robert, C., & Mackie, A. S. (2014). Assessment of the discharge process in a tertiary-care pediatric cardiology unit. Canadian Journal of Cardiology, 30(10, Supplement), S187-S188.

Schuh, M., Schendel, S., Klassen, K., Morrison, L., Rankin, K. N., Robert, C., & Mackie, A. S. (2014). Assessment of the discharge process in a tertiary-care pediatric cardiology unit. Canadian Journal of Cardiology, 30(10, Supplement), S187-S188.

Schuh, M., Schendel, S., Islam, S., Klassen, K., Morrison, L., Rankin, K. N., Robert, C. and Mackie, A. S. (2016), Parent readiness for discharge from a tertiary care pediatric cardiology unit. J Spec Pediatr Nurs, 21: 139–146.

citation:Description.dsDescription:Text: Using a survey research design with a convenience sample, the investigators will evaluate discharge teaching in the Pediatric Cardiology Unit at the Stollery Children's Hospital. The survey tool will provide anonymous data from parents related to their children's hospitalization and discharge from hospital.

ore:describes.socialscience:Frequency: Data was collected at time of discharge and two weeks after discharge.
ore:describes.socialscience:Universe: Parents, guardians and caregivers of pediatric patients who are discharged from the Pediatric Cardiology Unit at the Stollery Children's Hospital.
ore:describes.socialscience:Sampling Procedure: The target sample was 200 study participants; the actual sample was 181 study participants, chosen through a convenience sample.
ore:describes.Title: Assessment of Discharge Process from the Pediatric Cardiology Unit
ore:describes.Alternative Title: Assessment of Pediatric Cardiology Discharge Teaching
ore:describes.socialscience:Characteristics of Data Co: Two sets of questionnaires were administered two weeks apart to assess the quality of discharge teaching from the inpatient unit. The questionnaires included questions about the child's hospital stay and validated tools that measure the quality of discharge teaching. The first questionnaire was completed on the date of discharge and the second questionnaire set was completed two weeks after discharge; the second set of questionnaires was sent out either by e-mail (through EPro, Women and Children's Health Research Institute) or by regular mail (with a self-addressed, stamped envelope for return) as preferred by the participant.
ore:describes.Subject: Medicine, Health and Life Sciences
ore:describes.socialscience:Collection Mode: Self-administered questionnaire: Paper; Self-administered questionnaire: Web-based
ore:describes.Data Sources: Readiness for Hospital Discharge Scale (RDHS); Care Transitions Measure (CTM-3); Quality of Discharge Teaching Scale (QDTS)
ore:describes.schema:name: Assessment of Discharge Process from the Pediatric Cardiology Unit
ore:describes.dvcore:conditions: Access to deidentified data may be permitted for external researchers, with limitations. The data producer determines access on a case-by-case basis. Contact the data producer directly to discuss terms and conditions of access.
ore:describes.schema:includedInDataCatalog: Women and Children's Health Research Institute (WCHRI)
